subject: Olympic Games (2008)
Track and Field
lead_paragraph: Christine Ohuruogu, the world 400-meter champion, won her appeal against a lifetime Olympic ban for missing doping tests. Ohuruogu, a 23-year-old British runner, was cleared to compete in next year’s Beijing Olympics after the ruling by a sports arbitration panel. The British Olympic Association said the panel approved Ohuruogu’s appeal because of “significant mitigating circumstances.” Ohuruogu was the first British track athlete punished for missing three tests. She said she missed the tests when her training schedules were changed with late notice.
